headline: Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream

author.name: Elise Bauer
author.description: Elise founded Simply Recipes in 2003 and led the site until 2019. She has an MA in Food Research from Stanford University.

alumniOf.Name: Stanford University: BS in Environmental Science; MA in Food Research; MBA from the Graduate School of Business

description: This homemade vanilla ice cream is made with a custard base, sugar, cream, and real vanilla beans. It’s a classic and so good! Serve it with caramel sauce or on a slice of apple pie!

video.description: In this video, you'll learn how to make vanilla ice cream. This homemade vanilla ice cream is made with a custard base, sugar, cream, and real vanilla beans. This classic vanilla ice cream recipe is great to serve alongside a brownie, a slice of pie, or your favorite dessert. You can also top this homemade vanilla ice cream with caramel sauce or sprinkles. Watch this video to learn how to make your own vanilla ice cream.
video.name: Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream Recipe

name: Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream
keywords: Freezer-friendly, Make-ahead, Ice Cream, Vanilla, French, Gluten-Free, Dessert, Christmas, Favorite Summer, Holiday, Thanksgiving
recipeIngredient: 2 vanilla beans, split in half lengthwise

recipeInstructions.text: Infuse the milk and cream with vanilla: Put the milk and 1 1/2 cups of the cream, half of the sugar, and the salt into a saucepan on medium heat. Use the tip of a sharp knife to scrape out the tiny seeds from the vanilla beans, and stir both the seeds and the pods into the milk cream mixture. Heat until steamy, but not simmering. Remove from heat, cover, and let stand while the vanilla infuses, about 20 to 30 minutes.

Beat egg yolks with half of the sugar: In a medium bowl, beat together the yolks and the remaining half of the sugar. You can use a hand mixer or beat by hand using a whisk. Beat until velvety smooth and creamy.

Prepare a bowl over an ice bath: Fill a large bowl half way with ice and cold water. Set a smaller metal bowl inside of it, and place the remaining cup of cream inside to chill. Place a strainer over the smaller bowl. Set aside.

Temper the eggs: Reheat the milk/cream mixture until it is just barely steamy (not boiling!). Vigorously whisk the eggs while you slowly dribble half of the milk/cream mixture into it. Pour the egg mixture into the pot with the remaining cream and milk.

Cook the custard: Cook over medium high heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of your spoon (about 180°F on an instant read thermometer). You can run your finger in a line over the back of the coated spoon. If the mixture doesn't run, but stays in place on the spoon, it should be thick enough.

Strain the custard: Remove from heat and immediately pour the custard through the the strainer you've placed over the bowl with cream in the ice bath. This will strain out the vanilla beans, and quickly lower the temp of the custard to stop it from cooking further.
Chill the custard: Let the custard cool completely, stirring to help chill it quickly. Put into the refrigerator and let chill for at least an hour, preferably several hours.
Churn in an ice cream maker: Freeze custard in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions. (Take care not to over churn the ice cream or it will get a grainy texture.)

Freeze: If you serve the ice cream immediately, it will have the consistency of soft serve ice cream. Freeze it for at least an hour in an airtight plastic container to have a firmer texture. If it has been frozen for more than a day, you may need to let it sit at room temperature for a few minutes to soften before serving it.

review.reviewBody: This is now my go-to vanilla ice cream recipe. It is the best! I like that it uses so many egg yolks and 2 vanilla beans. With garden chickens, I am always looking for uses for eggs. I have a few minor modifications. I use real cream, but instead of dairy milk, I use oat milk, since we never have dairy milk on hand. The only other alteration is I use Himalayan sea salt and I double it. This is a really delicious ice cream. Just made a batter, can't wait for tomorrow when I will churn it for Sunday dinner's dessert.
